title: U.S. stocks edge higher, testing all time highs in final session before Christmas
text:
FDA adds Merck antiviral to COVID-19 tool kit for high-risk adults above 18 amid flurry of positive news on boosters

The U.S. Food and Drug Administration authorized Merck's COVID-19 antiviral for adults who have tested positive for the virus and are at high risk of disease progression early Thursday, granting it a more limited use than the rival one from Pfizer that was authorized on Wednesday. See full story.

U.S. consumer sentiment showing gradual improvement, UMich survey shows

The University of Michigan's gauge of consumer sentiment rose slightly to a final December reading of 70.6 from the initial reading of 70.4, staying above November's final level of 67.4. See full story.

I'll have $5 million for retirement when I sell my dental practice next year â€” but my wife and kids don't want me to retire

Have a question about your own retirement savings? Email us at HelpMeRetire@marketwatch.com See full story.

These wild market forecasts have a 50% chance of coming true in 2022, says hedge-fund investor

Our call of the day veers into what-if territory, with some rather outrageous (or maybe not) market forecasts gathered by hedge-fund manager Doug Kass. See full story.

MARKETWATCH PERSONAL FINANCE

The winter season isn't as cold as it was roughly 50 years ago, especially in the U.S. Northeast and for Great Lakes cities. See full story.
